    "deletions": 2,
    "changes": 19,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/fd97ee1e4fbb33a25e7bd9f5d288f8ffe4af5220/docs%2Fexternal-id%2Fcustomers%2Fconcept-authentication-methods-customers.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/fd97ee1e4fbb33a25e7bd9f5d288f8ffe4af5220/docs%2Fexternal-id%2Fcustomers%2Fconcept-authentication-methods-customers.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fexternal-id%2Fcustomers%2Fconcept-authentication-methods-customers.md?ref=fd97ee1e4fbb33a25e7bd9f5d288f8ffe4af5220",
    "patch": "@@ -1,15 +1,14 @@\n ---\n title: Identity providers for external tenants\n description: Learn sign-in and MFA options for customer identity and access management (CIAM), including email, one-time passcodes, social providers, SAML/WS-Fed, and OIDC.\n-\n ms.author: cmulligan\n author: csmulligan\n manager: dougeby\n ms.service: entra-external-id\n  \n ms.subservice: external\n ms.topic: concept-article\n-ms.date: 05/07/2025\n+ms.date: 10/07/2025\n ms.custom: it-pro, seo-july-2024\n #customer intent: As an External ID administrator, I want to configure and enable multiple identity providers (such as email one-time passcode, Google, Facebook, Apple, SAML/WS-Fed, and custom OIDC) for external users, so that they can easily sign in and access our apps and resources.\n ---\n@@ -100,6 +99,22 @@ You can set up a custom OpenID Connect (OIDC) identity provider to allow users t\n \n Learn how to [set up a custom OIDC identity provider](how-to-custom-oidc-federation-customers.md).\n \n+## Issuer acceleration\n+\n+When you use identity providers such as Facebook, Google, Apple, custom OIDC, or SAML, users usually see the Microsoft sign-in page first. From there, they choose their identity provider. To simplify this experience, you can use the `domain_hint` parameter in the sign-in URL. This parameter lets you skip the Microsoft sign-in page and go directly to the selected identity provider’s sign-in page.\n+\n+### Issuer acceleration for custom OIDC providers\n+\n+For a custom OIDC identity provider, use the domain part of the **Issuer URI** in the `domain_hint` syntax.\n+\n+:::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/concept-authentication-methods-customers/domain-issuer-open-id-connect.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot showing the domain part of the issuer URI.\":::\n+\n+### Issuer acceleration for custom SAML providers\n+\n+For a custom SAML identity provider, use the domain specified in the **Domain name of federating IdP** field in the `domain_hint` syntax.\n+\n+:::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/concept-authentication-methods-customers/domain-issuer-saml.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot showing the domain name of the federating IdP.\":::\n+\n ## Updating sign-in methods\n \n At any time, you can update the sign-in options for an app. For example, you can add social identity providers or change the local account sign-in method."
  },

    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/fd97ee1e4fbb33a25e7bd9f5d288f8ffe4af5220/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Fhow-to-configure-domain-controllers.md",

    "patch": "@@ -17,7 +17,7 @@ This guide describes how to configure Microsoft Entra Private Access for Active\n \n ## Prerequisites\n \n-To configure Microsoft Entra Private Access for Active Directory Domain Controllers, you must have:\n+To configure Microsoft Entra Private Access for Active Directory Domain Controllers, you must have the following:\n \n - The **Global Secure Access Administrator** role in Microsoft Entra ID.\n - The product requires licensing. For details, see the licensing section of [What is Global Secure Access](overview-what-is-global-secure-access.md). If needed, you can [purchase licenses or get trial licenses](https://aka.ms/azureadlicense)."
  },
  {
    "sha": "9dfce779a1e0953aa824ecc70fef8f6b7c5b1495",
    "filename": "docs/global-secure-access/reference-china-user-support.md",
    "status": "modified",
    "additions": 4,
    "deletions": 7,
    "changes": 11,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/fd97ee1e4fbb33a25e7bd9f5d288f8ffe4af5220/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Freference-china-user-support.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/fd97ee1e4fbb33a25e7bd9f5d288f8ffe4af5220/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Freference-china-user-support.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Freference-china-user-support.md?ref=fd97ee1e4fbb33a25e7bd9f5d288f8ffe4af5220",
    "patch": "@@ -12,16 +12,13 @@ ms.reviewer: sumeetmittal\n # Customer intent: As an IT admin, I want to evaluate the regulatory constraints of using Global Secure Access in China so that I can ensure compliance and plan connectivity strategies effectively.   \n ---\n \n-# Global Secure Access support in China (Preview)\n+# Global Secure Access support in China\n Microsoft supports Global Secure Access capabilities in China, offering secure and compliant connectivity solutions tailored to the needs of organizations operating in China. \n \n-> [!IMPORTANT]\n-> Global Secure Access support in China is currently in PREVIEW.\n-> This information relates to a prerelease functionality that might be substantially modified before release. Microsoft makes no warranties, expressed or implied, with respect to the information provided in this article.\n-\n There are two scenarios that are applicable to Global Secure Access in China:      \n-- Global Secure Access availability for customer tenants deployed on Microsoft Azure in China. **Microsoft currently doesn’t support this scenario**. \n-- Global Secure Access availability for tenants outside China. This scenario includes use cases where Global Secure Access customers with a presence in multiple geographies make a temporary visit to China. For example, when an employee of USA-based company Contoso, using Global Secure Access, travels to China. **Microsoft supports this scenario**.    \n+- Global Secure Access availability for **customer tenants deployed on Microsoft Azure in China**. **Microsoft currently doesn’t support this scenario**. \n+- Global Secure Access availability for **customer tenants deployed on Microsoft Azure outside China**. **Microsoft supports this scenario**.\n+  - This scenario includes use cases where Global Secure Access (GSA) customers with a presence in multiple geographies and tenants deployed outside China use GSA while in China. For example, when an employee of USA-based company Contoso, using GSA, travels to China.     \n \n However, it’s important to recognize the specific connectivity disclaimers that apply to Secure Access Service Edge (SASE) providers operating in China. Because of regulatory restrictions and local infrastructure requirements, SASE providers might encounter:    \n - **Service limitations**: Connectivity performance can vary because of internet regulations and restrictions on VPN usage. Local routing policies can also affect network latency and bandwidth. Because connectivity is unpredictable, user experience might vary. "
  }
]. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary.","role":"user"}
ai_summary.Response:
Here's a summary of the changes:

The documentation for external identity for customers has been updated to include information on issuer acceleration for custom OIDC and SAML identity providers, along with new screenshots. Minor edits were made to the Global Secure Access documentation regarding prerequisites and support for China, clarifying the distinction between tenants hosted in China and those hosted outside China.
